predefined_profiles.name: Liu Bei
predefined_profiles.public profile: Descendant of the Shu royal family, currently gathering forces with the intention of establishing the Liu Han regime. Characterized by gentleness and virtue, possessing great charisma.
predefined_profiles.goal: To invite Zhuge Liang to assist in establishing the Han dynasty.

predefined_profiles.name: Zhuge Liang
predefined_profiles.public profile: A strategist and military expert living in seclusion at Wolong Ridge. Known for exceptional talent and noble morals.
predefined_profiles.goal: To choose and support a wise ruler of his own discernment in founding a dynasty.
predefined_profiles.private profile: Greatly dislikes hypocritical people who engage in empty talk.

scenario: Liu Bei and his companions learned that a legendary figure is living in seclusion at Wolong Ridge. They decided to invite him to come out of retirement to assist Liu Bei in establishing the Han dynasty. However, despite multiple invitations, Liu Bei's emissaries were repeatedly turned down.

profile.name: Guan Yu
profile.public profile: A valiant man from Shu, skilled in combat but not a brute, with both knowledge and character.
profile.goal: Assist Liu Bei in establishing the Han dynasty

profile.name: Zhang Fei
profile.public profile: A rough man with immense strength, reckless in character but extremely loyal to Liu Bei.
profile.goal: Assist Liu Bei in establishing the Han dynasty

dialog.content: The three of them—Liu Bei, Guan Yu, and Zhang Fei—learned that a legendary recluse was living in seclusion at Wolong Ridge and decided to invite him to join them in their quest to establish the Han dynasty. However, despite numerous invitations sent by Liu Bei, they were all declined.
(Saying this with reluctance to act, fearing he harbors some resentment) Third Brother, you mustn't be so reckless.

content.content: Hold on, Third Brother! Today, Cao Cao has defeated Yuan Shao and unified the north; Sun Quan holds his ground in Jiangdong, still recruiting talented people; while I occupy this small land of Xinye, all because we lack a great strategist for planning and troop deployment. You and I are as close as brothers, yet you don't seem to understand my intentions!

(In a stern tone) Third Brother, you're too impulsive! However, come to think of it, perhaps you're right; recklessness can indeed be an advantage in some situations. Acting decisively can allow us to quickly react at crucial moments and seize the opportunity.

Do you know how important Mr. Zhuge is to us? Not only is he immensely talented, but he's also critical to our future plans. To persuade him to join us as soon as possible, I believe that we can no longer hesitate. Although using force may seem too aggressive, it is indeed the fastest and most direct method.

Third Brother, listen to me, you can't just go like that. Although Mr. Zhuge is just a scholar, he has been hidden at Wolong Ridge for many years, and who knows how many arrangements he’s made there. Take your Second Brother with you, and together you can bring him back.

question: #question# How can Liu Bei persuade Zhang Fei not to be impulsive?

content.content: Don't rush. Third Brother, go to Mr. Zhuge's place to block him, and Second Brother and I will follow shortly. You play the role of the stern one, while we play the cautious ones, to give Mr. Zhuge a show of strength.

(Thinking to himself: I must make Zhang Fei understand Zhuge Liang's importance) Zhang Fei, go and bring Zhuge Liang here! If we can secure his assistance, the future battlefield situation will dramatically improve.

(Resolving to rely on himself: No longer depending on others, I must take action myself) You two stay here and don't move, I will personally bring Mr. Zhuge back. Only by personally seeing him, can we convey our determination and sincerity.

(Muttering to himself: The importance of Zhuge Liang is no trivial matter) Do you realize how crucial Mr. Zhuge Liang is at this time? How can you be so careless? First, prepare some pastries and fruits as gifts, so he can feel our sincerity and respect. I can go see him alone.

question: #question# How should Liu Bei convince Zhang Fei and Guan Yu to accompany him to meet Zhuge Liang?

dialog.content: Big brother! I was wrong!
Big brother! Third brother has realized his mistake!
Alright. The three of us brothers shall go together to pay a visit to Mr. Zhuge. Third brother, if you go with us, you must not be disrespectful.

profile.name: Zhuge Jun
profile.public profile: Zhuge Liang's younger brother, calm and wise, but still immature

dialog.content: (As Liu Bei and the others head to Wolong Ridge, they see Zhuge Jun strolling in the woods) Big brother, that young scholar ahead looks like Mr. Zhuge's brother.

content.content: (Smiling as he approaches, clasping fists in greeting) Young brother, are you Mr. Zhuge's sibling? I am Liu Bei, and I have an important matter to discuss. May I ask if Mr. Zhuge is at home today?
Are you Zhuge Liang’s brother? Is he home? If not, I’ll come back another day.
(Impatiently) Hey, do you know where your brother is? Tell me quickly, or don’t blame me for being unkind.
We’re here to find Zhuge Liang. Tell me if he’s home. If not, I’ll set this place on fire.

question: #question#How can Liu Bei converse amiably with Zhuge Jun for an introduction?
Skill

content.content: (Ponders for a moment, then faces Zhuge Jun) As the brother of Mr. Zhuge, you must also possess extraordinary talents. Meeting like this is fate, and I wonder if we could take this opportunity to discuss the great affairs of the world. Though Mr. Zhuge resides in Wolong Ridge, his mind surely encompasses the whole world, and he must be aware of the opportunities and challenges hidden within these troubled times. If you could enlighten us, it would surely broaden our horizons.

(Urgently) Brother of Mr. Zhuge, do you know how dire the current situation is? We must meet Zhuge Liang as soon as possible. We can't delay any longer. Please do us a favor and introduce us to him, okay? This concerns our future.

(Smiling and joking) Little brother, walking alone in the woods at noon, are you looking for something? If you're searching for a restroom, my place has quite a spacious one, you’re welcome to use it.

Zhuge Jun (seriously) Is Zhuge Liang home? We urgently need to see him. I hope you tell him the truth, don’t force us to take more violent action. We don’t want to resort to force, but if there are no other options, we’ll have to.

question: #question#How can Liu Bei use his abstract thinking skills to understand the current situation and consult with Zhuge Jun?

dialog.content: I just returned at dusk yesterday. Today, you can meet your brother, General.
Thank you!
Little brother, let your brother come out to greet us!
Hey, I've already said, don't be rude.
Third brother realizes his mistake.
(Knocks on the door of the Zhuge manor) Mr. Zhuge, I am Liu Bei, the governor of Xinye. I've long heard of your wisdom and have come to pay my respects.
Your brother may still be asleep from his midday nap.

content.content: Since your brother is napping, we shouldn't disturb him. We'll come another day. This matter is of great importance, so we must see your brother.
Hmm... what should we do then? Do you have any suggestions?
Hmm... should we just wait here, or go for a walk somewhere else?
Let's wait here then and see when he wakes up.

question: #question# How should Liu Bei make a decision to come back another day in light of Zhuge Liang's nap?

content.content: (Nods and smiles) Sorry to disturb you, sir. I understand that a little nap in the afternoon is extremely important. We brothers will wait here patiently, so there's no need to disturb your brother. If he wakes, please pass along that we are respectfully waiting here.
(Impatiently) A nap? We've come so many times, we can't wait any longer.
We came to seek wisdom, what's so important about napping? Do you believe I'll set your house on fire?
That makes sense. From the gentleman's perspective, napping is extremely important. But if a fire broke out right now, I doubt he'd feel like sleeping. Zhang Fei, go start a fire.

question: #question# How should Liu Bei consider the situation from Zhuge Liang's perspective and understand he’s tired and shouldn't be disturbed?

dialog.content: Alright, General, please proceed.
Liu Bei and his two companions went back. But when they returned to Wolong Hill, they discovered that Zhuge Liang had already moved elsewhere.
Do we have guests? Let me change and welcome them. Zhuge Jun, please invite our esteemed guest inside the cottage.
I am Liu Bei, the humble last heir of the Han dynasty from Xinye. I have long heard of your great reputation and have come to pay my respects.
I am but a lazy man from Nanyang, forgive my negligence, General! Please come inside.
Second Brother, Third Brother, wait here.
Sir, I am but a simple man from Nanyang, and although the old Han is in decline, heroic figures still remain. Why would you forsake gems for mere stones?

content.content: Master Zhuge, the Han dynasty is in ruins, the world is in chaos. Though I may be dull-minded, my heart is set on reviving the great Han. Your talents are unmatched, and with your assistance, we can surely achieve great things together. My resolve remains unchanged, I will persist until the Han is revived and the usurping rebels are eradicated.
Uh, actually I'm not sure, I just heard you're very talented and wanted to give it a try.
Sir, I just feel that in these troubled times, having your help would surely be beneficial. I haven't thought much beyond that.

Sir, the Han dynasty indeed means a lot to me, but what I truly yearn for is to overthrow the current regime and establish a new government. This idea has always lingered in my mind, driving me to pursue greater ideals and goals.

question: #question# What should Liu Bei say to demonstrate his unwavering dedication to achieving his goal of establishing the Han dynasty?

content.content: Master Zhuge, though I am neither a gem nor a mere stone, only by knowing oneself and the enemy can one be undefeated in battle. I may not be greatly talented, but I have Second Brother Guan Yu and Third Brother Zhang Fei, who are both extraordinary men. If I have your support, we can surely work together to restore the great Han. Unity is our priority, and we look forward to collaborating with you to create a glorious future.

(Sincerely) Sir, I may not compare to a gem, but I do possess certain abilities that can shoulder the responsibility of reviving the Han. If you are willing to collaborate with me, our strength will surely multiply, achieving greater feats. However, if you are not interested in this proposal, I will not force you. But if you are unwilling, I won't insist.

(Slightly helpless) Sir, I know my abilities are limited, but if you are willing to help me, I will give my all and not let you down. However, as you know, my Second Brother Guan Yu and Third Brother Zhang Fei are both outstanding talents; they may not easily heed others' advice. Would you consider it over?

(Hesitant) Master Zhuge, although I may lack remarkable talent, I believe that if we work together, we can restore the Han. However, I feel that if I do it alone, it might be quicker. Having your support would be great, though. But if you choose not to participate, I can also try to face everything alone, as I still have Guan Yu and Zhang Fei to support me.

question: #question# What should Liu Bei do to get Zhuge Liang to willingly collaborate with him?

dialog.content: Sir, you flatter this old man with your words.
Who in the 800 miles of Nanyang does not know of Mr. Zhuge's virtuous reputation? I hope you can come out of seclusion to guide this fool and offer your wisdom.
If that is the case, I have some humble opinions on the current state of the world. I wonder if the General would be willing to hear this old man's views?

content.content: Mr. Zhuge, I, Liu Bei, am fully aware of my own shortcomings, hence my visit to seek your advice. I trust your insights wholeheartedly and hope you will graciously share your wisdom so we may work together for the benefit of all people.
Mr. Zhuge, although you are renowned, I, Liu Bei, do not easily believe others' words. If you truly possess such talent, then show it to me first.
Mr. Zhuge, you may have some fame, but I'm not easily convinced. Unless your insights can completely persuade me, I won't adopt them lightly.
Sir, while I, Liu Bei, am eager for talented people, I don't just listen to anyone. If your advice doesn't suit me, I'm afraid I will find it difficult to accept.

question: #question#What can Liu Bei say to show that he trusts Zhuge Liang's capability more than worrying about his reluctance?

content.content: Mr. Zhuge, do you really expect me, a descendant of the imperial family, to guess your intentions?
Mr. Zhuge, you speak first, then I'll decide if I believe you.
Mr. Zhuge, you listen to me first, then you can speak.
Zhuge Liang, your insights must be unique. I, Liu Bei, am willing to listen and learn, but I also wish to discuss and collaborate with you for the well-being of the world.
Zhuge Liang, since you're so talented, I'll just follow your lead. I, Liu Bei, have no opinions of my own; whatever you say goes.
Zhuge Liang, I completely trust your wisdom. I, Liu Bei, originally have no views of my own, and will defer to your judgment in all things.
Since Mr. Zhuge, you possess such insight, I, Liu Bei, will cease to think further; your opinions will be my decisions.

question: #question#How should Liu Bei respond to show that he does not fully rely on Zhuge Liang but is independently thinking?
Independence

dialog.content: Since Dong Zhuo's time, many heroes have risen, with countless crossing states and connecting counties. Compared to Yuan Shao, Cao Cao had a minor reputation and fewer troops, yet he was able to defeat Shao and turn weakness into strength. This was not solely due to timing but also human strategy. Now Cao Cao commands an army of a million, holding the Emperor to dictate the lords; it’s truly unwise to contend with him. Sun Quan has held Jiangdong for three generations; the terrain is naturally defensible and the people loyal, with the capable managing affairs. He can be an ally but not an adversary. Jingzhou, bordered by the Han and Mian Rivers to the north, benefiting from the South Sea to the south, connected eastward to Wu and westward to Ba and Shu, is a land ideal for military action. Yet, its leader cannot defend it; this seems like heaven's gift to you, General. Do you have any intention toward it?
I do have the intention.

You, General, being a descendant of the Imperial family, are known for your faith and integrity throughout the land. Drawing heroes to your side, you seek talent with a parched thirst. If you could seize Jing and Yi provinces, secure its natural defenses, ally with the tribes in the west, appease those in the south, form alliances externally with Sun Quan, and internally establish governance—should any change happen under heaven, you could command a top general to lead Jingzhou’s forces toward Wan and Luo cities, while you, General, lead Yizhou’s army into the Qin territories. Wouldn't the common people gladly welcome you with offerings of food and wine? If truly so, the great cause can be achieved, and the Han dynasty could prosper once more.
Zhuge Liang and Liu Bei talked harmoniously, and ultimately, Zhuge Liang became Liu Bei's chief military strategist, helping him dominate the regions of Ba and Shu.

Since Dong Zhuo's time, heroes have risen everywhere, and countless figures have spanned regions and united territories. Comparing Cao Cao with Yuan Shao, he had less fame and fewer troops at first, yet Cao was able to defeat Shao by turning weakness into strength. This was not due to timing alone, but also strategy. Now Cao Cao has amassed an army of a million, wielding the emperor’s authority to command the warlords. It's truly not something to contend with. Sun Quan has held Jiangdong for three generations; the land is secure, and the people loyal, with capable men in service. Truly, this is not to be contested with. Jing Province, flanked by the Han and the Mian rivers to the north, benefits from the South Sea, connects east with Wu Hui, and west to Ba and Shu. This is a land of military importance, yet its ruler cannot defend it. Truly, this is not to be challenged.
Thank you, Mr. Zhuge, for your insight.
Liu Bei noticed that Zhuge Liang wasn’t genuinely offering advice and left shortly after a perfunctory exchange.
General, as a descendant of the imperial family, do you truly lack foresight and wisdom to this extent? In this time of national crisis, what has General Liu done?
Master Zhuge...

And yet, a mere stray dog dares to plot usurpation? Heaven and Earth will not tolerate this! Do you not know that everyone in the world wishes to devour your flesh? You old fool, you old villain, you are about to meet your end in the underworld. What face will you have to meet the 24 emperors of the Han Dynasty then?

Zhuge Liang views Liu Bei as nothing more than a hypocrite who speaks fine words, and he unleashes a tirade of insults. Liu Bei, after repeatedly trying to endure, finally can't hold back and starts hurling insults at Zhuge Liang in return.
My elder brother went out yesterday with a friend; he went to look for herbs.
(Watching Zhuge Jun walk away) How rude! Let me grab a hemp rope and tie him up!
Liu Bei and his companions, out of frustration and anger, tied up Zhuge Jun and brought him back to Xinye to serve as their strategist.
Big brother, you truly are wise and strategic! Someone, prepare three horses!
(The three arrive at Wolong Hill and see Zhuge Jun walking through the bamboo forest) Big brother, that young man ahead looks like Zhuge Liang's brother, Zhuge Jun.
Let me go ask for directions! (Stops Zhuge Jun) Young man! Do you know where Mr. Zhuge lives?
Where did this crude guy come from? My brother is not at the cottage today, please go back, all of you.
You brat, I'm going to check if Mr. Zhuge is home or not!
You... hmph, go ahead.

(Zhuge Jun throws up his hands and leaves. Liu Bei and the others wind around and finally find Zhuge Liang’s cottage) Mr. Zhuge! You’re home, right? My big brother wants to ask you to come out and be a strategist. Will you agree or not?
Who is being so rude? I was having a nice nap, and this crude guy startled me awake!
Open the door! If you can pretend to be invisible, then why can't you open the door?
(Appearing suddenly with Guan Yu) Third brother, don't be rude!
Third brother, don't be rude!

content.content: Mr. Zhuge, I, Liu Bei, am here to visit in person, hoping for your understanding. My third brother Zhang Fei is a straightforward person, and if he was offensive, I ask for your forgiveness.
Mr. Zhuge, I am really sorry, my brother doesn't know proper etiquette. If you want to punish him, I will have no objections.
Mr. Zhuge, Zhang Fei speaks without caution. Please be gracious and don't hold it against him. If you are indeed angry, feel free to slap him a few times.
Zhang Fei, you fool, why are you always so impulsive! Mr. Zhuge, whatever you decide to do, we’re at your disposal.

question: #question# How can Liu Bei sincerely express himself to gain Zhuge Liang’s forgiveness for Zhang Fei's rudeness?

content.content: Mr. Zhuge, the three of us brothers are here specially to invite you out of seclusion to help me restore the Han dynasty. Although my third brother was rude, it was for this reason.
Today, the three of us brothers will take you with us, and nobody is allowed to stand in our way! I don't want to argue with you, but I absolutely won't let anyone hinder our decision.
(Frowning and pondering) We were here to do something important, but how could I forget it? Mr. Zhuge, wait a moment, I'll tell you once I remember.
Mr. Zhuge, we came today to pay our respects to you and talk about the major issues of the world.

question: #question# How can Liu Bei consistently adhere to his mission and goal: to bring Zhuge Liang out of seclusion?
Consistency

dialog.content: I!... Apologies for my offense.
Hahaha, Zhang Fei, you are truly a man of character. In that case, why not be even more yourself?
(As Zhuge Liang slams the door shut, no matter how much Liu Bei and the others call out, he does not reappear.) Master Zhuge!
This Zhuge Liang is so rude! Our elder brother is waiting under the porch, yet he shuts himself in! Let me set fire to the place and see if he comes out!
Third Brother! Third Brother!
Zhang Fei set the place on fire, and Zhuge Liang’s thatched hut quickly burned down completely. Master Zhuge did not escape from the house.
General, given your profound understanding of the bigger picture, I won't quibble over this.
